properties.name: camel.component.google-sheets-stream.access-token
properties.description: OAuth 2 access token. This typically expires after an hour so refreshToken is recommended for long term usage.

properties.name: camel.component.google-sheets-stream.application-name
properties.description: Google sheets application name. Example would be camel-google-sheets/1.0

properties.name: camel.component.google-sheets-stream.autowired-enabled
properties.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

properties.name: camel.component.google-sheets-stream.bridge-error-handler
properties.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

properties.name: camel.component.google-sheets-stream.client-factory
properties.description: To use the GoogleSheetsClientFactory as factory for creating the client. Will by default use BatchGoogleSheetsClientFactory. The option is a org.apache.camel.component.google.sheets.GoogleSheetsClientFactory type.

properties.name: camel.component.google-sheets-stream.client-id
properties.description: Client ID of the sheets application

properties.name: camel.component.google-sheets-stream.client-secret
properties.description: Client secret of the sheets application

properties.name: camel.component.google-sheets-stream.configuration
properties.description: To use the shared configuration. The option is a org.apache.camel.component.google.sheets.stream.GoogleSheetsStreamConfiguration type.

properties.name: camel.component.google-sheets-stream.delegate
properties.description: Delegate for wide-domain service account

properties.name: camel.component.google-sheets-stream.enabled
properties.description: Whether to enable auto configuration of the google-sheets-stream component. This is enabled by default.

properties.name: camel.component.google-sheets-stream.include-grid-data
properties.description: True if grid data should be returned.

properties.name: camel.component.google-sheets-stream.major-dimension
properties.description: Specifies the major dimension that results should use..

properties.name: camel.component.google-sheets-stream.max-results
properties.description: Specify the maximum number of returned results. This will limit the number of rows in a returned value range data set or the number of returned value ranges in a batch request.

properties.name: camel.component.google-sheets-stream.range
properties.description: Specifies the range of rows and columns in a sheet to get data from.

properties.name: camel.component.google-sheets-stream.refresh-token
properties.description: OAuth 2 refresh token. Using this, the Google Calendar component can obtain a new accessToken whenever the current one expires - a necessity if the application is long-lived.

properties.name: camel.component.google-sheets-stream.scopes
properties.description: Specifies the level of permissions you want a sheets application to have to a user account. See https://developers.google.com/identity/protocols/googlescopes for more info.

properties.name: camel.component.google-sheets-stream.service-account-key
properties.description: Sets .json file with credentials for Service account

properties.name: camel.component.google-sheets-stream.split-results
properties.description: True if value range result should be split into rows or columns to process each of them individually. When true each row or column is represented with a separate exchange in batch processing. Otherwise value range object is used as exchange junk size.

properties.name: camel.component.google-sheets-stream.value-render-option
properties.description: Determines how values should be rendered in the output.

properties.name: camel.component.google-sheets.access-token
properties.description: OAuth 2 access token. This typically expires after an hour so refreshToken is recommended for long term usage.

properties.name: camel.component.google-sheets.application-name
properties.description: Google Sheets application name. Example would be camel-google-sheets/1.0

properties.name: camel.component.google-sheets.autowired-enabled
properties.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

properties.name: camel.component.google-sheets.bridge-error-handler
properties.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

properties.name: camel.component.google-sheets.client-factory
properties.description: To use the GoogleSheetsClientFactory as factory for creating the client. Will by default use BatchGoogleSheetsClientFactory. The option is a org.apache.camel.component.google.sheets.GoogleSheetsClientFactory type.

properties.name: camel.component.google-sheets.client-id
properties.description: Client ID of the sheets application

properties.name: camel.component.google-sheets.client-secret
properties.description: Client secret of the sheets application

properties.name: camel.component.google-sheets.configuration
properties.description: To use the shared configuration. The option is a org.apache.camel.component.google.sheets.GoogleSheetsConfiguration type.

properties.name: camel.component.google-sheets.delegate
properties.description: Delegate for wide-domain service account

properties.name: camel.component.google-sheets.enabled
properties.description: Whether to enable auto configuration of the google-sheets component. This is enabled by default.

properties.name: camel.component.google-sheets.lazy-start-producer
properties.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

properties.name: camel.component.google-sheets.refresh-token
properties.description: OAuth 2 refresh token. Using this, the Google Sheets component can obtain a new accessToken whenever the current one expires - a necessity if the application is long-lived.

properties.name: camel.component.google-sheets.scopes
properties.description: Sheets scopes

properties.name: camel.component.google-sheets.service-account-key
properties.description: Sets .json file with credentials for Service account

properties.name: camel.component.google-sheets.split-result
properties.description: When consumer return an array or collection this will generate one exchange per element, and their routes will be executed once for each exchange. Set this value to false to use a single exchange for the entire list or array.
